entry.title: Projective surfaces in $\mathbb{P}^4$ that are counterexamples to the Eisenbud-Goto regularity conjecture
entry.summary: It is well known that the Eisenbud-Goto regularity conjecture is true for projective curves, smooth surfaces, smooth threefolds in $\mathbb{P}^5$, and toric varieties of codimension two. After J. McCoullgh and I. Peeva constructed counterexamples, it has been an interesting question to find the categories such that the Eisenbud-Goto conjecture holds. So far, a counterexample of a projective surface has not been found while counterexamples of dimension three or higher are known. In this paper, we construct counterexamples to the Eisenbud-Goto conjecture for projective surfaces in $\mathbb{P}^4$, and investigate some projective invariants and cohomological properties of them. In addition, we give a counterexample of a threefold in $\mathbb{P}^5$ that is regular in codimension one. These counterexamples are constructed via binomial rational maps between projective spaces.
